Leaded Stained Glass Courses

Leaded stained glass breaks are available throughout the year, at dates to suit yourself. Please e-mail or phone us (before 9pm please) to check availability. Because we specialise in small group sizes, we can usually fit you in with no need to meet minimum numbers for our Chilham classes.

A few events currently in the pipeline are:-

  • Tuesday 4th – Thursday 6th August: “Traditional Leaded Lights”.

    Learn to cut glass and lead. Explore the geometric shapes and patterns popular in the last 200 years and produce your own leaded panel to take home.

  • Saturday 29th – Monday 31st August (bank holiday weekend): “Leaded landscapes”.

    Bring a photo of your own or take inspiration from our beautiful setting, nestled in the Kent Downs AONB. (A stroll around the medieval village of Chilham, a walk or visit to some local viewpoints are free optional extras, to immerse yourself more into the landscape.)

    Capture the beauty of the scenery in a landscape panel, using the leaded stained glass technique.

  • Friday 9th – Sunday 11th October: Leaded designs, ancient and modern.

    Choose your favourite hymn or song and translate it into a leaded glass design. (Tip: “There is a green hill far away” or “Away in a manger” might be easier than “We are marching” or “I surrender”!) Alternatively, choose a classic leaded light design from the last two centuries as your inspiration.

    Your finished glass panel will be suitable for hanging or standing in a window, to show off your talents.

  • Monday 26th – Tuesday 27th October: Leaded glass panels for beginners and improvers.

    Learn how to design your own leaded light, then turn it into reality using our wide range of glass, to make an artwork to be proud of. Bring some pictures or design ideas for inspiration.
